messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:01): <input type=file accept> seems problematic
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:03): there don't seem to be any use cases that limit the type without also limiting other things, like image size, framerate, audio codec, or whatever
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:03): so it seems pointless to keep it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:04): the main use case was to enable on-the-fly video/audio/photo upload, but maybe we're better off providing direct access to the camera/mic
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (03:05): that seems like that should be part of the file-upload spec
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:05): yeah, i was about to say that it seems like something to punt to the binary data work
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (03:05): which arun will be editing, it seems
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (03:06): I do agree we need to allow (controlled) access to camera & mic
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:06): yeah that's been requested a lot from cutting-edge app authors
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (03:07): well, Flash has had it for many years
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:07): yup
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (03:07): and I'm sure Silverlight has it (or will)
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (03:08): hmmm... wonder how that plays into uploading RAW files from a USB camera/memory card? or would that just be a normal file upload?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:08): dunno
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:09): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: accept is more useful as a hint than a limit
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:09): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: so the UA can show a specialized media browser for audio, video or image types for example
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:09): instead of generic file open dialog
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (03:09): those files are huge... but photo-editing webapps would do well to allow them
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:09): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: does anyone do that? or have any plans to?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:10): Apple does not comment on future product releases
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:11): but I think it would be a swell idea, given that both Mac OS X and the iPhone have specific media picker UIs

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:11): hypothetically, should someone want this to remain in the spec, would they want it to just be image|video|audio|mime-type ? or just image|audio|video ? or just mime-type? or something more elaborate?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:11): comma separated list, any mime supertype? parameters?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:11): I don't know if any of the other base MIME types are particularly useful
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:11): text and application don't tell you much
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:12): I guess font is a root type though?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:12): multipart either
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:12): application  audio  example  image  message  model  multipart  text  video
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:12): anyway the semantics I describe are not really exactly what would be implied by "accept"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:13): html4 has accept="mime/type" iirc
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:14): wf2 has accept="mime/type,mime/type,mime/type" (comma-separated list) where any of the mime/type entries can be mime/* or */* as well
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:14): single instance of mime/* (or just the base part) is the use case I would be most interested in
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:16): HTML4 has a comma-separated list
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:16): so i propose making it a comma-separated list _or_ one of "image", "video", "audio"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:17): and the selected file(s) must either have the given types or be of the given category
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:17): sound good?
15acf9951f4c900b4605265783e17a5d (03:24): would there be any use in allowing multiple types at once for the latter?
15acf9951f4c900b4605265783e17a5d (03:25): say, "image,audio"?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:30): what's the use case?
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (03:43): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Silverlight doesn't have it
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:45): flickr might want an "image,video" uploader
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:45): (if this results in a media browser with only image and video categories, say)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:46): hm, true
